result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad R Schweitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Execution of the sentence is stayed for not more than 60 days or until a date set by the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer, which ever date occurs first.  The defendant shall report to the Waupaca County Jail on the sentencing date to confirm a reporting date with the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer.
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).

Elements

Defendant Chad R Schweitzer in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per DA Snider, amend charge to misdemeanor battery re: 940.19(1). 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed with the Court.
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights, and enters no contest plea to amended charge.
Per DA Snider, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty re: amended charge. 
Court orders defendant to 6 months jail with Huber privileges, to begin within 60 days and pay costs.
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
